body.p: A set of options controls , allowing you to configure most of the features. To offer you the highest degree of flexibility in customizing the application to fit the end-user's role in your organization, comes with several distinct layers of option values, arranged here according to their priority, from low to high:

ul.li:
Default Options - should be regarded as factory defaults or built-in values.
This predefined set of values are tuned so behaves optimally in most working environments.

Customized Default Options - designed to customize the initial option values for a group of users.
This layer allows an administrator to deploy the application preconfigured with a standardized set of option values.Once this layer is set, it represents the initial state of when an end-user presses the Restore defaults or Reset Global Options buttons.
Global Options - allows individual users to personalize according to their specific needs.

Project Options - allow project managers to establish a set of rules for a specific project. These rules standardize the information exchanged by the team members (for example, if the project is stored in a repository, a common set of formatting rules avoid conflicts that may appear when documents modified by different team members are committed to the repository).

body.note: If you set a specific option in one of the layers, but it is not applied in the application, make sure that one of the higher priority layers is not overwriting it.
